oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Brass buttons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two small blackened brass buttons marked with a Texas state seal (Lone Star). TEXAS is written in raised letters around the five-pointed star. Since this object was manufactured in the North, it most likely predates the Civil War. Scoville Manufacturing Co. of Waterbury, Conn., produced many such military buttons. Purchased in South Carolina.
